title: Taliban’s new diplomatic dawn in Afghanistan: Why the world is coming in from the cold
description: Isolated since 2021, the Islamist group is now rebuilding ties with many countries, despite a fierce dispute with former patron Pakistan
content:
In October, Amir Khan Muttaqi, the Afghan Talibans foreign minister, visited the Islamic seminary of Darul Uloom in the north Indian city of Deoband.

raw_data.author: Humza Jilani in Islamabad, Andres Schipani in Deoband, Anastasia Stognei in Berlin and Edward White in Shanghai
